Chapter 2 Data sources 2.1 General Information of Dataset 2.2 Describtion of Variable 2.3 Issue of Data set

Chapter 2 Data sources The aim of this project is to analyze the changes in the population of international students studying in the United States from various countries in recent years. The data was collected from All Places of Origin, Open Door, which is sponsored by the U.S. Government and Institute of International Education. We selected international students for from 1949 to 2020 from various regions, including Africa, Asia, Europe, Latin America & Caribbean, Middle East, Oceania. library(readxl) library(tidyverse) library(stringr) 2.1 General Information of Dataset projdata <- read_excel("Census_All-Places-of-Origin_OD21.xlsx", col_types = c("numeric", "text", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric", "numeric"), na = "-", col_names = T) names(projdata)[1] <- "Code of Origin" projdata <- projdata %>% select(`Place of Origin`,`Code of Origin`, `1949/50`:`2020/21`) nrow(projdata) ## [1] 299 ncol(projdata) ## [1] 34 Table 2.1: A table of the first 4 rows of our final project data. Place of Origin Code of Origin 1949/50 1954/55 1959/60 1964/65 1969/70 1974/75 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA AFRICA, SUB-SAHARAN 1000 537 862 1346 5259 6064 16040 Africa, Sub-saharan, Unspecified NA 19 NA NA 9 17 30 NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA 2.2 Describtion of Variable Based on these outputs, we can find that the raw data has the following 34 columns and 299 rows: Code of origin: the region and code of each country, represented by 4 digit Place of origin: the name of the continent and country researched. 1949/50: the number of international students in US in Academic Year 1949 - 2020 2020/21: the number of international students in US in Academic Year 2020 - 2021 2.3 Issue of Data set 2.3.1 For missing Value There are a lot of NAs in the dataset, but there are some that do not make sense. Because the data source is in Excel format and separating it with blank lines is a common Excel method. 2.3.2 For Place of Origin The format for countries and continents is not uniform. So, we have to modify it to the same format before analysis.
